name: Opik Demo Structured Output
description: Hard JSON schemas from JSONSchemaBench Github_hard dataset for testing structured output generation.

exporterOptions.description: Optional exporter options for this model.

models.description: Optional array of models within this model.

notes.description: An author may wish to add notes to this model instance.

origin.description: Optional origin location of this model.

paths.description: Optional array of path objects in this model.

type.description: A model may want to specify its type, but this value is not employed yet.

units.description: Optional unit system of this model. See UnitType for possible values.

MakerJs.IPath.description: A line, curved line or other simple two dimensional shape.

origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

MakerJs.IPathArc.description:
An arc path.

Examples:
```
var arc: IPathArc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //typescript
var arc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //javascript
```

endAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to end drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction. May be less than start angle if it past 360.

origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

startAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to begin drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction.

type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

MakerJs.IPathCircle.description:
A circle path.

Examples:
```
var circle: IPathCircle = { type: 'circle', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7 };   //typescript
var circle = { type: 'circle', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7 };   //javascript
```

origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

MakerJs.IPathLine.description:
A line path.

Examples:
```
var line: IPathLine = { type: 'line', origin: [0, 0], end: [1, 1] };   //typescript
var line = { type: 'line', origin: [0, 0], end: [1, 1] };   //javascript
```

end.description: The end point defining the line. The start point is the origin.

origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

MakerJs.IPoint.description:
An x-y point in a two-dimensional space.
Implemented as an array with 2 elements. The first element is x, the second element is y.

Examples:
```
var p: IPoint = [0, 0];   //typescript
var p = [0, 0];   //javascript
```

exporterOptions.description: Optional exporter options for this model.

models.description: Optional array of models within this model.

notes.description: An author may wish to add notes to this model instance.

origin.description: Optional origin location of this model.

paths.description: Optional array of path objects in this model.

type.description: A model may want to specify its type, but this value is not employed yet.

units.description: Optional unit system of this model. See UnitType for possible values.

birthname.title: Pigenavn (født)
birthname.description: Det eller de efternavne som vedkommende havde før giftemål.

lastnames.title: Mellem- og efternavne
lastnames.description: Alle nuværende mellem og efternavne i korrekt rækkefølge

occupation.description: Bør være en brance-betegnelse fra DB07
occupation.title: Erhverv

additional_optional_text.description: Дополнительный произвольный текст для печатной формы для ввода информации и документе, фиксирующем сроки начала строительства в случае, когда правонарушение — Не направлено извещение о начале строительства

assignee.description: Исполнитель по документу: Ссылка на сотрудника в справочнике "Сотрудники"

case_administrative_offence.description: Ссылка на Дело об АП, в рамках которого создаётся документ

number.description: Номер документа. Формируется автоматически по заданному алгоритму

optional_text.description: Произвольный текст для вывода в печатную форму блока дополнительных оснований для вынесения постановления

penner.description: Составитель (автор) документа: Ссылка на сотрудника в справочнике "Сотрудники"

empty_string.description: Признак добавления пустой строки для ручного заполнения информации о подписанте

soft_copy.description: Список с одним приложенным файлом. Используем везде массив для приемственности типов.

json_schema.title: OSVR Display Descriptor (v1)
json_schema.description: This schema documents and guides creation of a display descriptor, that describes properties of a head-mounted display

meta.title: JSON Schema metadata
meta.description: Details about the JSON display descriptor schema.

schemaVersion.title: Schema Version
schemaVersion.description: Version number of the display descriptor JSON schema. If you're using this schema, the value should be 1

num_displays.title: Number of physical screens (NOT USED)
num_displays.description: This is redundant with information elsewhere in the schema and should not be used.

field_of_view.title: HMD Field of View Description
field_of_view.description: Defines the optical parameters of the HMD. Since some HMDs have partial overlap – meaning that the viewing direction of the left and right eye are not identical – we define the field of view of just one eye and then the overlap between them.

overlap_percent.title: Percentage of horizontal FOV that is 'overlapped'.

pitch_tilt.title: Pitch tilt in degrees (NOT HANDLED)
pitch_tilt.description: Some HMDs have their field of view tilted downwards. In this case, pitch_tilt would have a non-zero value in degrees, where positive is a downward tilt.

items.title: HMD Resolution Description
items.description: Describes HMD properties related to resolution.

width.title: Horizontal size, in pixels, of a video input.

height.title: Vertical size, in pixels, of a video input.

video_inputs.title: Number of distinct video inputs
video_inputs.description: Some HMDs have 2 separate inputs, one for each eye.

display_mode.title: Display Mode
display_mode.description: If a single input is used in side-by-side mode, width and height show the entire width and height of both sides combined.

distortion.title: HMD Distortion Description
distortion.description: Describes HMD properties related to distortion shader.

rendering.title: HMD Rendering Description (NOT HANDLED)
rendering.description: Describes HMD properties related to rendering. These parameters are not used - please use the per-eye rotate_180 parameter for now

eyes.title: HMD Eyes Description
eyes.description: Describes HMD properties related to eyes.

anyOf.title: Flip Display Rotation
anyOf.description: Indicates if the view needs to flipped 180 degrees on the z axis (that is, in the plane of the screen) - 1 for true, 0 for false.

anyOf.title: Flip Display Rotation
anyOf.description: Indicates if the view needs to flipped 180 degrees on the z axis (that is, in the plane of the screen)

linearEquations.description: Array containing any number of 3-arrays. Each inner 3-array describes a line segment: [boundary, slope, intercept]. So [1, 2, 3] would mean 'where (next_boundary > x >= 1), y = 2x + 3'

liquidHandlingSpecs.description: Object containing linear equations for translating between uL of liquid and mm of plunger travel. There is one linear equation for aspiration and one for dispense

editConfigurations.description: Object allowing you to modify a config

config.description: Version-level pipette specifications, which may vary across different versions of the same pipette

name.description: reference to name of this version, should match a key in corresponding pipetteNameSpecs.json file

backCompatNames.description: Optional reference for name of backwards compatible pipette corresponding to a key in pipetteNameSpecs.json, only relevant to gen2 pipettes

tipOverlap.description: Map of tip overlap values with defaults
tipOverlap.$comment: Other keys in here should be labware URIs

mutableConfigs.description: Array of mutable configs for a given pipette

validQuirks.description: Array of valid quirks for a given pipette

title.description: The title of the question (e.g., 'Addition of vectors in Cartesian coordinates').

secondaryTopics.description: Other topics also covered by the question (e.g., 'Vectors', 'Energy').

items.description: A single topic covered by the question.

tags.description: Extra tags associated with the question (e.g., 'Exam Only', 'Broken').

items.description: A tag associated with a question.

clientFiles.description: The list of question files accessible by the client (defaults to ["client.js"]).

items.description: A single file accessible by the client.

clientTemplates.description: List of client-accessible templates to render server-side.

items.description: A single template file accessible by the client.

template.description: The QID of a question that serves at the template for this question.

gradingMethod.description: The grading method used for this question.

singleVariant.description: Whether the question is not randomized and only generates a single variant (defaults to "false").

partialCredit.description: Whether the question will give partial points for fractional scores (defaults to "false" for v2 questions and "true" for v3.).

options.description: Options that define how the question will work, specific to the individual question type.

enabled.description: Whether the external grader is currently enabled. Useful if it is breaking, for example.

image.description: The Docker image that will be used to grade this question. Should be specified as Dockerhub image.

entrypoint.description: Program to run as the entrypoint to your grader. Must be runnable as 'chmod +x script && ./script'.

serverFilesCourse.description: The list of files or directories that will be copied from course/externalGradingFiles/ to /grade/shared/

items.description: A single file or directory that will be copied to the external grader.

timeout.description: The number of seconds after which the grading job will timeout.

enableNetworking.description: Whether the grading containers should have network access. Access is disabled by default.

coreStyles.description: The styles required by this question from /public/stylesheets.

coreScripts.description: The scripts required by this question from /public/javascripts.

nodeModulesStyles.description: The styles required by this question from /node_modules.

nodeModulesScripts.description: The scripts required by this question from /node_modules.

clientFilesCourseStyles.description: The styles required by this question from clientFilesCourse.

clientFilesCourseScripts.description: The styles required by this question from clientFilesCourse.

clientFilesQuestionStyles.description: The styles required by this question from clientFilesQuestion.

items.description: A .css file located in the clientFilesQuestion.

clientFilesQuestionScripts.description: The scripts required by this question from clientFilesQuestion.

items.description: A .js file located in the clientFilesQuestion.

image.description: The Docker image that will be used to serve this question. Should be specified as Dockerhub image.

port.description: The port number used in the Docker image.

gradedFiles.description: The list of files or directories that will be copied for grading.

items.description: A single file or directory that will be copied for grading.

json_schema.title: Backend Config
json_schema.description: A configuration file for the PrairieLearn server.

secretKey.description: Secret key for authenticating users (should be a long random string).

postgresqlUser.description: The user for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

postgresqlDatabase.description: The database for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

postgresqlHost.description: The host for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

redisUrl.description: The url for connecting to Redis.

logFilename.description: Filename to use for server logging.

authType.description: The type of authentication to use.

serverType.description: The type of server to start.

sslKeyFile.description: Path to SSL certificate key file

sslCAFile.description: Path to SSL CA chain file

serverPort.description: The TCP port number for the server.

groupName.description: The group of servers we belong to, used for load reporting and autoscaling.

blockedWarnEnable.description: Whether to detect and warn on blockages in the event loop.

blockedAtWarnEnable.description: Whether to use more expensive event-loop-blocking detection that includes stack traces (not for routine use in production).

blockedWarnThresholdMS.description: The threshold (in milliseconds) for detecting event-loop blockages.

checkAccessRulesExamUuid.description: On sync, check if assessment access rules examUuid exists in database (default false)

autoFinishAgeMins.description: Time after last activity when exams are auto-closed (minutes).

runningInEc2.description: Whether PL is running as an AWS EC2 instance

externalGradingUseAws.description: If the external grader should use AWS (production) or not (local dev).

externalGradingS3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket that externally graded jobs should be stored in.

externalGradingResultsS3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket where externally graded job results will be stored.

externalGradingJobQueue.description: The name of the job queue where externally graded jobs will be submitted.

externalGradingJobRole.description: The ARN of the role that should be provided to external grading containers for resource access.

externalGradingWebhookUrl.description: The endpoint that should be hit when a grading result is updated. Should be null when running locally.

externalGradingDefaultTimeout.description: The default timeout to use for external grading if none is specified by a question.

externalGradingPullImagesFromDockerHub.description: Whether externally graded questions should automatically pull container images from Docker Hub (true) or use only locally cached images (false)

workersCount.description: The number of workers to use (or null to use workersPerCpu).

workersPerCpu.description: The number of workers per CPU (if workersCount is null).

cmd_def.description: OpenPulse command definition schema. Defines QASM commands in terms of pulses.

qubits.description: Qubits to which this command def applies

complex.description: JSON representation of a complex number

complex_array.description: JSON representation of a complex vector

complex_matrix.description: JSON representation of a complex matrix

cmd_def.description: Backend calibrated QASM to Pulse definitions

json_schema.title: qobj results
json_schema.description: The results of executing a qobj

complex.description: JSON representation of a complex number

complex_array.description: JSON representation of a complex vector

complex_matrix.description: JSON representation of a complex matrix

shots.description: The starting and ending shot for this data. If there is only one shot to the experiment this is [1,1]

success.description: If true, we can trust results for this experiment.

status.description: Human-readable description of status of this experiment

meas_return.description: Is the data averaged or from each shot

header.description: Header passed through from the qobj with experiment metadata

counts.description: Histogram of the memory over the indicated shots

snapshots.description: collection of all snapshots of simulator state

backend_version.description: Backend version in the form X.X.X

job_id.description: Unique execution id from the backend

success.description: True if complete input qobj executed correctly. (Implies each experiment success)

status.description: Human-readable status of complete qobj execution

header.description: Header passed through from the qobj with job metadata

results.description: Corresponding results for array of experiments of the input qobj

label.title: Field label
label.description: Field labels are auto-generated from field names. This option allows to control the label

renderAs.title: Render value
renderAs.description: Non-default rendering of the field value

orderBy.title: Order by field
orderBy.description: Field name to use for ordering

format.title: Date/time format
format.description: Date time format for time stamp fields

precision.title: Numeric precision
precision.description: How many digits to render after the floating point

linkTo.title: Link value to URL
linkTo.description: URL to use for linking rendered values (use %s as placeholder)

linkTarget.title: Link target for value URL
linkTarget.description: Target for link value URL (_blank, _self, _parent, _top, framename)

limit.title: Limit of field entity outputs
limit.description: Used for aggregate fields, like file uploads

min.title: Minimal value
min.description: Define a minimal value for field

placeholder.title: Placeholder attribute used in HTML tags
placeholder.description: Define placeholder attr for input/textarea tags

timeIncrement.title: Datetime Picker Minutes increment
timeIncrement.description: Define time increment for minutes dropdown

showMonthYearSelect.title: Show year month dropdowns
showMonthYearSelect.description: Show year and month select boxes above calendars to jump to a specific month and year

timePicker.title: Adding time handlers into popup
timePicker.description: Adds select boxes to choose times in addition to dates

max.title: Maximal value
max.description: Define a maximal value for field

step.title: Step value
step.description: Define a step value to increase/decrease numeric field

fileUploadAdapter.title: Upload Adapter
fileUploadAdapter.description: Define Upload Adapter for FileStorage plugin

personal.title: Personal Identifiable Information (PII)
personal.description: Define PPI (US term), personal data (EU term) and sensitive data (EU term)

help.title: Help tooltip
help.description: Add help tooltip next to the label of the field

json_schema.title: Scheduling Block Instance (SBI)
json_schema.description: Schema for a SIP interpretation of an SKA SBI

processing_blocks.description: Array of PBs defined for this SBI

scans.description: Array of Scans assocaited with this SBI

id.description: Unique identifier given by the server

name.description: A name to identify the rule.

active.description: Enable/Disable a rule. When disabled, the rule is not evaluated on events received.

organizationId.description: The organization for which the rule is configured.

conditions.description: List of condition to evaluate against events received.

items.description: Condition to evaluate, **MUST** define at least one of the three condition criteria: `eventSourceId`, `eventTypeId` or `fn`.

description.description: Human friendly text to let the possibility to explain what the condition evaluates.

eventSource.description: Define the data for an event source

id.description: The event source to match on event received. If not present, joker `*` will be used.

generatedIdentifier.description: Unique identifier generated by iFLUX server of the event source usable in the events.

eventType.description: Define the data for an event type

id.description: The event type to match on event received. If not present, joker `*` will be used.

type.description: Event type used in the events sent.

fn.description: Javascript expression to be evaluated. If not present, only `event source` and `event type` will be evaluated.

expression.description: Javascript expression to let more complex condition matching. **MUST** be a valid javascript expression

sampleEvent.description: A valid event that will be evaluated to true with the expression.

transformations.description: List of transformations to apply to an event once the conditions matched.

description.description: Human friendly text to let the possibility to explain what the transformation does.

actionTarget.description: Define the data for an action target

id.description: The action target to send the event transformed.

generatedIdentifier.description: Unique identifier generated by iFLUX server of the action target sent with actions.

actionType.description: Define the data for an action type

type.description: Action type used in the actions sent.

fn.description: Javascript expression to transform the events. If not present, event is not transformed and passed as it is received.

expression.description: Javascript expression to let more complex transformation. **MUST** be a valid javascript expression

sample.description: A valid sample to validate the transformation expression.

event.description: A valid event for the transformation expression validation.

eventSourceTemplateId.description: The event source template to inject to the transformation validation.

eventTypeId.description: The event type to inject to the transformation validation.

evaluate-condition.description: Evaluate the properties, e.g. speed > 5. Note that we only support one level of brackets.

inside-condition.description: Geo-fence: check whether the updated feature, or the feature with ID featureId, is inside the area.

featureId.description: ID of the feature that must be checked whether it is inside the area.

polyId.description: ID of the feature that represents the polygon area (geo-fence).

static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

nearby-condition.description: Check whether the updated feature is near the point.

distance.description: Distance to the reference location in units

locationId.description: ID of the feature that represents the reference point.

locationLatLng.description: Specifies the reference location in latitude and longitude.

static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

units.description: Specifies the unit type in which the distance is measured.

method.description: Name of the method to execute at the receiver.

oneOf.description: Attach either the complete feature, its properties or geometry to the message.
Alternatively, you can also provide an attached object.

message.description: Message to show in the client.

publisher.description: The publisher type - may be superfluous after renaming the method to sendImbMessage.

json_schema.description: Describes a rule, which consists of zero or more conditions that must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the one or more actions

actions.description: An array of actions: each action is executed when the rule is triggered.

delayInMSec.description: Delay in milliseconds before triggering the action.

actions.title: Actions schema.

activatedAt.description: The time the rule is activated.

activationType.description: Determines when the rule should be activated / triggered.

conditions.description: An array of AND conditions: each condition must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the actions in the rule.
conditions.title: Conditions schema.

description.description: Description of the rule's purpose. Solely used for documentation purposes.
description.title: Description schema.

featureId.description: Feature (ID) this rule applies too. If the featureId is specified, the rule is not generic.

isActive.description: A rule may start active, meaning it will be evaluated every time, or inactive, waiting for activation to occur.
isActive.title: IsActive schema.

isGeneric.description: If true, indicates that we are dealing with a rule that is not bound to a specific feature, but applied to all.

recurrence.description: How often may the rule fire. In case the value is -1, fire continuously.
recurrence.title: Recurrence schema.

json_schema.title: Rule schema.
